column4: it detects your sound card fine so maybe gstreamer is conflicting with another program
it says UNCLAIMED though. is that right?!
K3ito i'm not the best at linux hardware.  i didnt want your problem to go ignored though
i do often find that restarting helps but im a noob
no worries ;)  I'm just stumped.  it was working fine a second ago
i think its some conflict.  are you running kde on that system

K3ito:  so you do have KDE on that system.  are you running in it right now?  I ask because when I had KDE on my system a whole lot of stuff would clash and not work.  Gnome properties would hang, audio would stop running in KDE.  i ended up just picking Gnome and everything works fine.
oh wow..  i mixed up usernames really badly
yes, but it has worked fine before
K3ito: a software conflict is the only idea i have.  but i don't know much.
i tried updating some software and it hung then i hard reset adnd noticed it.  don't know 100%that was the cause but it's possible
do you know what file it hung on?
K3ito: well i would think that would mess more with your graphics than your sound, but it might have something to do with it
